newsitem.title: UK: Siebe spends 20.3 mln stg on German unit.
newsitem.headline: Siebe spends 20.3 mln stg on German unit.

text.p: Siebe Plc said on Tuesday it had agreed in principle to buy Mannesmann Demags Compressed Air Division for 20.3 million stg.
It said the Demag division had pretax, post-interest profit of 0.7 million stg in 1995 on sales of 72.1 million stg.
Siebe said the company, which employs 567 people and had net assets of 20.3 million stg at June 30, would be integrated into its CompAir Division.
Demag's compressor division has a production unit at Simmern in Germany, which is also its headquarters.
It sells in Germany, France, Italy, Spain, Austria and the Benelux and has a well-established presence in South Africa, eastern Europe, south east Asia and the Middle East.
Siebe president Stuart Amos said the deal would bring the cmpany's worldwide compressor and related product proforma sales to around 420 million stg in the current year.
He said the deal, at 0.3 times sales, was expected to be non-dilutive.
